Color¶

class decodes.core.dc_color.Color(a=None, b=None, c=None)¶

a simple color class

__init__(a=None, b=None, c=None)¶

Color constructor.

Parameters:
  • a (float) – First color value (between 0.0 and 1.0). Defaults to 0.5.
  • b (float) – Second color value (between 0.0 and 1.0). Defaults to 0.5.
  • c (float) – Third color value (between 0.0 and 1.0). Defaults to 0.5.
Result :

Color object.
Return type:

Color
static HSB(h, s=1, b=1)¶

Creates a color object from HSB values.

Parameters:
  • h (float) – H color value (between 0.0 and 1.0).
  • s (float) – S color value (between 0.0 and 1.0). Defaults to 1.
  • b (float) – B color value (between 0.0 and 1.0). Defaults to 1.
Result :

Color object.
Return type:

Color
static RGB(r, g, b)¶

Creates a color object from RGB values.

Parameters:
  • r (float) – R color value (between 0.0 and 1.0).
  • g (float) – G color value (between 0.0 and 1.0).
  • b (float) – B color value (between 0.0 and 1.0).
Result :

Color object.
Return type:

Color

Returns hue value of this color.

Result :Decimal value representing hue.
Return type:float
i¶

Returns the i-value of this color.

Result :i-value of this color.
Return type:float
static interpolate(c0, c1, t=0.5)¶

Returns a new color interpolated from two Color objects.

Parameters:
  • c0 (Color) – First Color object
  • c1 (Color) – Second Color object
  • t (float) – Interpolation value (between 0.0 and 1.0). Defaults to 0.5.
Result :

Interpolated Color object.
Return type:

Color

Result :q-value of this color.
Return type:float

Returns saturation value of this color.

Result :Decimal value representing saturation.
Return type:float

Returns the numeric value of this color.

Result :Decimal value representing this color.
Return type:float

Returns the y-value of this color.

Result :y-value of this color.
